snippet: David H. Brooks, former chief executive of DHB Industries Inc., was given a 17-year sentence for a $185 million stock swindle in which the proceeds were used to finance personal luxuries.
abstract: David H Brooks, former chief executive of DHB Industries Inc, the country's leading supplier of body armor to the United States military, is sentenced to 17 years in prison for running a $185 million stock swindle in which he used the proceeds to finance personal luxuries.
lead_paragraph: David H. Brooks, former chief executive of DHB Industries Inc., was given a 17-year sentence for a $185 million stock swindle in which the proceeds were used to finance personal luxuries.

headline.main: Prison for Founder of Body Armor Company
